Posts.Title: Can rain and cold weather contribute bone aches? stellaratovsky blainejennifer

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2013 04:53PM LaurenS16 wrote: I started with osteoarthristis when I was 33, long before my breast cancer diagnosis. I've heard that the anti-hormonals, especially the AIs, can be really tough on your joints. I've been seeing a rheumatologist for years. My standard treatment is glucosamine/chondrotin supplements and fish oil supplements daily, and a two-day 40mg / day dose of steroids as needed. The supplements really do help. I haven't needed to take the steroids for over a year!

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2012 08:16AM LaurenS16 wrote: I've got a PET tomorrow too. My paperwork suggests eating: meat, fish, chicken, eggs, green beans, broccoli, asparagus, cauliflower, peanut butter, cheese, cottage cheese, butter, vegetable oil. Drinks: black coffee, unsweet tea, water NO: sugar, potatoes, rice, corn, carrots, breads, pasta, fruits, beets, juices, sugar substitutes.

I had a nice mushroom omelet for breakfasat. Right now, I'm trying to figure out if there is anything in the cafeteria I can eat at lunch. Ok, I'll be honest, I'm trying to figure out if there is anything in the cafeteria I can eat at lunch that I actually WANT to eat. The pinto beans and turnip greens aren't on my list of desired foods!

Posts.Content: May 21, 2013 09:32AM LaurenS16 wrote: That's me - letrozole and xgeva. I take the Simply Right Plant Calcium from Sam's Club. It has 1000 mg calcium, 70 mg magnesium, and 400 IU D3 in two tablets. I also take 4000 IU of D3 each day.
Posts.Title: Xgeva users - step up naturegirl2 Suesbooby2

Posts.Content: May 20, 2013 11:19AM LaurenS16 wrote: I've been on Xgeva for about a year. I usually feel "blah" for a few days after each shot. I've sometimes had muscle cramps in the week after the shot, and once my teeth just ached like crazy for a few days. Overall, the side effects have lessened over the last year, but I've also learned to take extra magnesium and potassium on the days before and after each shot.
